sub_topic: Prove that the empty set is a subset of every set.
message_1: Let A be a set of all odd prime numbers less than 10. If B is an empty set, prove that B is a subset of A.
message_2:
To prove that B is a subset of A, we need to show that every element in B is also an element in A.

The set A contains the odd prime numbers less than 10, which are {3, 5, 7}.

The set B is an empty set, which means it contains no elements. By definition, an empty set is a subset of any set, including A, because there are no elements in B that are not in A.

Therefore, B is a subset of A.
